facts: Some of the oldest known board games come from ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia and are more than 4,000 years old.
Chess is believed to have started in India as a game called chaturanga before spreading to Persia and Europe.
The game we call Monopoly was inspired by an earlier game designed to teach people about the problems of unfair wealth and land ownership.
Scrabble was created in the 1930s, and its letter tiles are weighted so common letters appear more often than rare ones.
Go has only a few simple rules but is considered one of the deepest strategy games because the number of possible board positions is enormous.
Many modern board games use cooperative play, meaning players work together to beat the game instead of competing against each other.
Board game pieces are often made from materials like wood, plastic, or cardboard, but some historic sets were crafted from ivory, stone, or metal.
